spell.name: Monolith
entries: You stomp the ground, raising an earthen pillar that fills a 5-foot cube within range which can be used as cover. If a pillar is raised under a creature, that creature must succeed on Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or be lifted by the pillar. A creature can choose to fail the save. Any existing pillar crumbles if you cast this spell again.

You can also attack with the pillar, although doing so ends the spell. As a part of casting this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can launch the pillar toward a creature of your choice within 60 feet of the pillar. Make a ranged spell attack, doing {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning damage on a hit.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Rockslide
entries: You control the ground beneath your feet, propelling you in a line toward an unoccupied space you can see within range. Each creature you pass through must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked prone.

spell.name: Tremorsense
entries: You clear your mind, extending your senses into the earth around you. For the duration, you have {@sense tremorsense} out to a range of 30 feet.

spell.name: Bolide

components.m: 1 cubic foot of earth, which the spell consumes

entries: A 4-inch diameter sphere of hard-packed earth forms in front of you, launching toward a target you can see. The sphere flies in a straight line toward the target, building speed as it soars, stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface. If the sphere strikes a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the bolide strikes the target and stops moving. The target then takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage per 20 feet the bolide traveled.
If the bolide travels more than 120 feet, the target, if a creature, has advantage on the saving throw. The bolide crumbles into harmless pebbles if it hits nothing within its range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Seismic Barrage
entries: You stomp the ground in front of you, launching earthen spikes towards up to five targets you can see within range. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC , taking {@dice 8d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Alternatively, all spikes can instead converge toward a single target, dealing {@dice 12d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Tectonic Carapece

components.m: 5 cubic feet of earth, which the spell consumes

entries: Earth and rock coalesce around you, creating an earthen suit of armor. You gain 50 temporary hit points. While you have these hit points, your speed is halved and you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. If any of these hit points remain when the spell ends, they are lost. While you have these hit points you gain the following benefits:

items: Your AC can't be lower than 20.
You gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 10 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Fault Line
entries: The earth splits, creating a ravine of jagged stone in a line originating from you that is 100 feet long and 15 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@dice 8d8} piercing damage and falling prone on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Additionally, the ground in that area becomes difficult terrain until cleared. Each 5-foot-square portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Earthen Dome
entries: You maintain concentration on a dome of hardened earth that encloses a creature or object with a size of Large or smaller within range in a 10-foot radius dome. An unwilling creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or be enclosed for the duration of the spell, which is 1 minute.

You may also cast this spell as a ritual. A 10-foot-radius immobile dome of hardened earthsprings into existence around you and up to 8 other creaturesof Medium size or smaller for 8 hours. You may dismiss the spell with an action.
Either way the spell is cast, the dome is 3 inches thick, has an AC of 18, has 200 hp, and is vulnerable to thunder damage.
